summary:
Brahmins are a caste in Hindu society, considered the highest in rank. They are known for their role as priests and spiritual leaders. Their traditional duties include performing rituals at temples and important life events like weddings. Brahmins are also respected as teachers.

While they are associated with religious and scholarly pursuits, historical texts show that Brahmins sometimes worked in other fields like farming, trading, and warfare. This highlights the diversity within this caste.
title: Brahmin
